1153321232.title: They're for plebs, gimme something else!

11533212321.content:
“And now, I think it’s time we see who’s really behind all this trouble!”

A mightyena donning a trilby announced proudly, standing next to a handcuffed criminal wearing a spooky mask. A crowd had formed around them, watching with bated breath as the mightyena pulls off the marauder’s mask. “Mr. Mcmillan?” The crowd all gasps in unison as his grumpy face is revealed. Everyone seems shocked… except for the mightyena!

“Why, of course!” She smiles, raising her snout proudly. “I knew it was him all along, ever since I saw that receipt for nose filters! That’s when I realized; he’s allergic to Pokémon! That’s why he’s been dressing up as the ghost of Giovanni. He was trying to scare all the Pokémon out of town!”

“And I would’ve, if it wasn’t for this meddling Mightyena!” The man grumbles angrily as he’s dragged away by the police, sneezing all the while. Meanwhile, the cheering crowd gathered around the mightyena, giving her belly rubs and poffins as thanks for her amazing detective work.

“Great work, Detective Mightyena! You cracked that case wide open!” The chief of police congratulated the canine.

“Oh, it was no problem at all, really,” she shrugged it off. “After all, no mystery is too difficult for the greatest Pokémon detective in all of Hoenn!”

The crowd all cheered, lifting the victorious detective up in their arms. Meanwhile, just offstage, a huge array of expensive cameras filmed the entire spectacle. “Aaannnddd…” The director shouted. “Cut!”



“It’s not a bad show. I mean, the kids still love it. But with all the recent competition, it just isn’t getting the ratings it used to,” you say, walking through Mauville City with the mightyena by your side. The latest episode of Detective Mightyena just aired today, and like all the recent episodes, its ratings have been mediocre compared to recent seasons. As the titular mightyena’s agent, you’re having some concerns about her career. “I mean, you have to admit, Detective Pikachu is just the superior show.”

“How could you say that? Detective Pikachu is a total rip off!” The mightyena groaned. To be specific, her name was Lesia, and she’s always been rather ‘ambitious’ by Pokémon standards. Rather than wanting to become the best fighter, Lesia always wanted to become a movie star, and dreamed of becoming a famous actress for Pokéstar Studios one day. She spent years teaching herself English, then kick started her career by pitching Detective Mightyena to the Pokémon Channel. Since that show has taken off, her popularity has slowly been building. However, the explosive premier of Detective Pikachu on Jubilife TV has been chipping away at that fame, and that’s been driving her up the wall.

“Be that as it may, the viewers have obviously made their decision. Its rise in fame has been… unprecedented. It’s one of the top shows on air right now,” you say, grimly. Lesia was often too haughty and ambitious for her own good, so as her agent, it was your job to ground her. “I’m not sure if our station will want to try to compete with that. Our show may not be renewed for another season, at this rate.”

Her ears droop, unable to come up with an argument. “Ugh… yeah, yeah, I know. You’re right,” she sighs, “but that just means we have to try even harder!”

You raise a brow, looking down at the grinning canine. “What do you mean?”

“You know! We have to think outside the box. Come up with something new, something people have never seen before!” She said, her voice brimming with excitement. “In fact, I think I have the idea for the perfect pitch…”

You frown. This idea of hers could either by something revolutionary, or something terrible. “Lay it on me.”

“Okay, but we’re going to have to take a detour to the prop warehouse first…” She said, suddenly making a sharp left turn in the direction of one of the studio warehouses. You pause, before deciding to follow her. “So, you know how Pokéstar Studios always makes their movies super bombastic and action-packed? In comparison, most TV shows are mostly just people talking, because they can’t afford to have that same kind of density of action scenes. Battles just take too much rehearsing, and special effects are too expensive,” she says as she walks, and you nod hesitantly. “Well, what if I told you I found a way to make single second of a show action-packed, while still having a super small budget?”

“I’d say you’re crazy,” you chuckle as you step into the warehouse. Without skipping a beat, the mightyena eagerly slips past you and walks over to a huge tarp, which is draped over something on the floor. Lesia excitedly pulls the tarp aside, to reveal a huge, miniature diorama of an entire city! She smiles up at you as you stare at the diorama, uncomprehending. “... what am I looked at, here?”

“I present the set of my new show; Attack of the 50-Foot Mightyena!” She smiles proudly, trotting around the diorama to demonstrate, careful not to break anything. “I found this old, completely realistic miniature replica of Mauville City, and I think it’d be perfect for the show! Think of it; just your average Mightyena suddenly growing to massive sizes, and terrorizing the entire town! Every single episode, you could have buildings crumbling, bridges collapsing, and battles against entire armies… and it’d be super cheap, since all the props are only a few centimeters big!”

You nod, starting to understand her idea. The diorama was pretty realistic. With a few clever perspective tricks, you could definitely make it look like a humongous Pokémon was actually rampaging through a town. “I dunno…” You said, tapping your chin. The Pokémon Channel has a pretty young audience, and you’re not sure the premise of this show would go over well. “Sounds a little scary for a children’s show.”

“We can market this one to older audiences! Branch out a little!” She insists. “There are too many kids shows already. It’s a saturated market. People want something more mature and dramatic nowadays. Something innovative!”

“Hmm… okay, I see what you’re getting at, here,” you nod contemplatively. This was actually a rather creative idea for a show. “So, how is it going to work? We don’t have the special effects budget to make it look like people are really in this diorama. Are all the characters in town just going to be little plastic figurines? That seems like it’d ruin the tension.”

“Aha! No, you see, that’s the real genius part,” she grins widely. “The characters of the show will just be regular actors… shrunken down!”

You stare at her, wondering if she’s joking. Nope, she’s serious. “... okay, you’ve lost me.”

She sorted through some boxes, until pulling out a plastic container filled with 6 colorful little cubes. “You know what a Miracle Block is, right?”

“They allow humans to use a Pokémon move, yes,” you nod, raising a brow.

“Well, these Blocks are infused with the move Minimize. So we just need to have the actors eat them, and they’ll shrink down to just the right size,” she says, looking a little nervous as she presented her idea, hoping you’d like it. “It’ll look super realistic! Trust me! I mean, there’s no harm in trying, right?”

You rubbed your chin as you contemplated her idea. Really, it could go either way. Either it’ll result in a pretty cool show, or it’ll result in something terrible. Guess that’s the risk you take in showbiz. “Okay. Interesting concept,” you say. “So what did you bring me here for?”

“Weeelll… I sort of need someone to help me film a pilot episode. Y’know, a proof of concept for my pitch,” she smiled, nervously. “I’ve already got everything set up and planned out. I just need somebody to play the whole of the, uh, ‘victim’.”

You frown. “I’m an agent, not an actor. This isn’t my job.”

“Please? Just as a favor? I mean, you’re the only person I trust with this...” She says, and the adorable look on her face as she pleads wore down on your willpower. Still, you were resolute. “I mean, if my career crumbles, you’re out of a job, too…” You sigh. Guess you can’t argue with that.

“Alright,” you relent, and the mightyena wags her tail wildly with excitement. “What do you need me to do?”
11533212321.title: Wanna-Be Movie Star

115332123211.content:
“Are you sure this is safe?”

“Absolutely,” the mightyena smiles up at you. “Minimize may make you smaller, but it doesn’t make you any more vulnerable, if that makes any sense. Like, if I accidentally stepped on you — which I won’t — you’d be completely unharmed.” You get chills at the thought as you look down at the block in your hands. Somehow, she wasn’t very reassuring.

“Alright. Here goes nothing...” You sigh, eventually working up the courage to pop the block in your mouth and start chewing. It actually tasted surprisingly pleasant, like gum, though when you swallowed it down, you got a slight sickly feeling in your gut as if you’d just taken a pill. “Okay, so… when’s it supposed to kick in?”

“It already has, you just have to use the move,” she instructs. “Just do what a Pokémon does. It’s kind of hard to explain, but… for a beginner, you can try closing your eyes, channelling all your energy, and just focusing your entire mind on the idea of shrinking.” Interesting. You always sort of wondered how Pokémon used their moves.

“Uh, alright…” You close your eyes and take a deep breath, focusing every bit of brain energy on visualizing yourself shrinking. You quickly slip into an almost meditative state, and sure enough, you can faintly feel yourself… changing. Eventually, the curiosity forced you to open your eyes. “Holy shit.” You gasped in surprise when you realized everything around you looked so much larger all of a sudden. Looking down at your body, you realized you were only four feet tall now, after only a few minutes of concentration.

“Language!” She frowned.

“Sorry! It’s just… I’ve never done this before…” You shudder, as you stare at your shrunken body. “This is… surreal…”

“Glad to see you’re having fun,” she smiles warmly. “I’ll give you some time. Try to shrink down to, say, three inches or so.” With that, she walks off to prepare the cameras, letting you concentrate.

“Jeez… this is insane...” You sigh, before closing your eyes again and focusing. You feel the changes become more and more drastic the longer you concentrate. Eventually, you work your way down to three inches. The next time you open your eyes, you’re almost knocked off your feet by the shock of how unbelievably tiny you now are. The buildings of the diorama now towered over you as if they were real. In fact, the entire ‘city’ seems incredibly realistic from this perspective. If you didn’t know better, you could fool yourself into believing you weren’t shrunken at all. “O-okay, I think I’m ready!” You cry out to Lesia. Interestingly, despite your tinier size, your voice was just as loud.

You stare in horror as you see Lesia round the corner. From this angle, she looked… humongous! She was over ten times your current size! It truly did look like a 50 foot tall Mightyena was rampaging through the city streets. When she noticed you standing there, she laid down in front of you, until you were eye-level with her. “Oh. My. Arceus. You are adorable!” She giggles, a smile on her huge face as you stare at her in awe. “Hehe! Not to be unprofessional or anything, but… you are the cutest thing I’ve ever seen! Look at you! You’re, like, smaller than a Joltik!”

“Yeah, yeah, I get it,” you say, your mind still overwhelmed by the sight of the towering mightyena before you. You know she would never harm you, but you still back away nervously, not wanting to be so close to the huge Pokémon. “J-just… be careful, alright? Don’t… step on me or anything.”

“Oh, don’t worry. I’m super careful. There’s no chance I’ll accidentally crush anything,” she smiles, standing up proudly. Just as she says that, her paw gets caught on a street light, and she goes fumbling backwards. “Aaahhh!” You winced as she loses her balance, coming crashing down on some buildings behind her, which let out a chilling cracking sound. She sits there for a moment, her eyes wide, realizing what she had just done. “Uh oh.”

“What do you mean, ‘uh oh’?” You grit your teeth.

“I think I might’ve just crushed the the gym building,” she frowned. She carefully stood up again, brushing the debris off her butt with her tail as she turned around to survey the damage. Sure enough, the small, paper building had crumbled completely beneath her weight. “Yep, it’s totaled.”

“Oh, great,” you groan, thinking that this was all for naught. “How are we going to shoot a show about Mauville without the Mauville gym?”

“Don’t worry! I know the guy who makes these. I can get it replaced super cheap. Like I said, this is a low budget production,” she chuckles. “In fact, crushing it was actually sort of fun…” With a mischievous smile on her face, she turns around, lifts her tail, and smashes her butt down on another small building, which is instantly crushed beneath her weight. “Whoo!” She giggled, amused by how easily the tiny buildings are squished beneath her. When she tries to stand, she accidentally destroys another building beneath her paw. “Oops! There goes the Pokecenter.”

“Come on, let’s take this seriously,” you frown. “No need to go sitting on all our props.” You were uncomfortable with what she was doing, not just because it was a waste of money, but also because the way those buildings collapsed seemed eerily realistic to you.

“Hehe! Oh, c’mon, I’m just getting into character!” She giggled, wagging her tail as she turned to you. “Maybe we can work this into the pilot. You know, start it off en media res. Oo, here’s an idea! Maybe the pilot can be, like, a found footage sort of thing. You can be a journalist reporting on the destruction from a helicopter, and I just smack you out of the sky! Then you run around for a bit, until the giant Mightyena swallows ya.”

“Swallows me?” You do a double-take.

“Well, not for real, obviously. We’re just acting,” she says nonchalantly, as if this was all no big deal. “I’ll just put you in my mouth for a few seconds, and make it look like I swallowed you. The audience won’t be able to tell the difference.”

You were uncomfortable just looking at the seemingly giant mightyena. The thought of going in her huge mouth made you feel nauseous. “I-I’m not too sure about this anymore,” you stutter.

“Oh, come on. I get that you’re uncomfortable, but I swear this is, like, one hundred thousand percent safe,” she leans down to try and reassure you. “Really, this could be my breakthrough role! Imagine it — I could be a Pokéstar because of this, and everyone would know that you’re the agent who made it happen!” You sigh. You guess you’re just… overreacting. There’s really no reason to believe Lesia would do anything that might harm you.

“... alright,” you relent, again unable to resist the mightyena’s adorable pouting. “Let's get ready for filming, then.”
115332123211.title: 50 Foot Mightyena

1153321232111.content:
The scene is a brightly-lit cityscape at night. The city streets are shrouded in fog, only the smoke of fires rising through the mist. Most chillingly, a huge pawprint is embedded in the side of one of the largest skyscrapers, the only evidence of the chaos happening below. Above the city, a helicopter flies bravely through the starry sky…

You’re standing by the open door of a remote controlled toy helicopter which was soaring through the ‘sky’, overlooking the fake city below. The foggy effect of the city below was accomplished by a smoke machine, and the buildings, which were actually hollow, are stuffed with lights in order to give off the illusion that the city below is bustling with activity. It actually looked surprisingly realistic, especially in the darkness. Dressed in a tiny newscaster costume, you turn to the micro-camera you’re carrying, holding a tiny microphone in your hand. “I am reporting live over the devastation of Mauville City. Early reports are claiming that a large Pokemon is responsible for the damage here…” You say into the microphone, trying to mimic a news reporter. You weren’t a very good actor, but the fact that you were genuinely nervous right now made your performance much more believable.

The ‘pilot’ of the helicopter was just a tiny cardboard cutout of somebody’s silhouette. In reality, it was being piloted via remote control by Lesia, who was hiding somewhere in the fog below. You try to improvise as the RC helicopter soars all around. “A-as you can see here, there seems to be, uh, cataclysmic damage done to this tower here. As you can see, there appears to be some sort of paw print embedded in the…” You say, before suddenly pausing when you see something moving in the smoke below. “Oh! It appears there’s something large moving in the fog! For the sake of our viewers, we will risk flying down and getting a closer look…”

You aimed the camera into the ‘smoke’ below as the helicopter slowly lowered, getting closer and closer. All of a sudden, a giant, furry tail came flying out of the fog, batting the helicopter out of the sky! The RC helicopter started spinning wildly out of control, and although you knew you were at no risk of harm, the sensation of falling was still terrifying. You screamed in genuine terror as the helicopter fell from the ‘sky’, before it finally crashed into the diorama below.

You cough as you lay there, your heart still pumping out of your chest. Eventually, you get your bearings, and keep trying to follow the script. “J-Jerry! Are you okay?” You call out, standing up on shaky legs. “Jerry?” You climb into the cockpit, only to find that the cardboard cutout there had been snapped in half during the fall. “Oh… Arceus. Ladies and gentlemen, it appears that my pilot… didn’t survive the crash.” You say, doing your best to sound sad. You crawl back, grabbing the camera before jumping out of the helicopter. You notice you happened to crash into the Game Corner. “I will be trying to escape the city on foot. If anybody’s watching this… the situation in Mauville is catastrophic. The military must be dispatched as soon as possible. This destruction cannot be allowed to continue.”

You wonder around the tiny, fake ‘city’, filming the fires and devastation that’s been left in the Mightyena’s wake. “The city is eerily quiet. I fear… there may not be anyone else left alive,” you say, trying to improvise a line to explain why there wasn’t any other actors in this pilot. After a few moments of wandering, you hear a loud noise in the distance, like huge, lumbering footsteps quickly approaching. “I-it’s coming!” You said as you breathlessly rushed to an alleyway, hiding amid some debris. You weren’t a very good actor, but the genuine nervousness you were feeling showed through in your shaky voice, making you sound genuinely terrified.

While you hide, eventually a huge figure emerges through the fog. The mightyena is so huge compared to you, your camera only shows her giant paws as she stomps by, her every footstep cracking the ‘pavement’. Eventually, the huge Pokemon passes you by, and you stumble out of the alleyway. “L-ladies and gentlemen, I can… confirm the reports that a Pokemon is involved in this disaster,” you whisper into the microphone as you flee in the other direction.

You rush through the tiny streets of the diorama with more urgency, now, having a few more brief brushes with the mightyena, narrowly escaping each time. Eventually, nearing the end of the pilot, you braced yourself for the moment you’ve been dreading the most. It was time to film the death scene.

You — or, perhaps you should say, your character — spots a giant paw pass by on one side of the alleyway, and thus rushes to the other side… only to find the giant mightyena standing there already, towering over you. You slowly lift the camera, giving the audience the first clear look of the seemingly huge mightyena’s face. She was giving the scariest smile she could, her fangs shining in the city lights. A bit of drool drips down onto the street in front of you. “Uh… good dog?” You whimper. In a single instant, those jaws descended around you, your camera falling to the floor as she lifts you up in her mouth.

The camera films every moment as you’re sealed entirely inside her huge, moist maw. It was absolutely sweltering in here, and the smell of her meaty breath was unbearable. You were forcibly pressed up against her wet tongue, and horrified by the view down her huge, gaping throat. With a cruel grin, she leans her head back, pretending to swallow you for the camera. You can only hope everything goes as planned, and you don’t accidentally end up as dog food...
1153321232111.title: Lights, Camera, Action!

choices: They loved it! ... but they have some stipulations
They hated it! ... looks like you're making a web series
11533212321111.content:
She swivells you around in her mouth for a while, keeping you in her maw for much longer than necessary for some reason. Eventually, she decides to let you go before it go too weird. “And… cut!” She announced, before leaning forward and gently spitting you out onto the ground. You land in a puddle of saliva on the ‘concrete’, coughing as you’re soaked to the bone in the mightyena’s juices. “That was a great take, man! I can work with this footage, if you don’t want to have to do all this again.” She smiles over you as you shakily climb to your feet, still covered from head to toe in smelly canine drool.

“Ugh… was that really necessary?” You groaned, trying to brush the thickest of the saliva off of yourself. “This is disgusting…”

“Hehe! Don’t worry, it’ll all come off when you return to your regular size,” she giggles, “which, come to think of it, should be happening right about… now.” Sure enough, a few seconds later, you feel your body start to shift and morph as you slowly grow in height. In the first minute, you only grew a few inches; in the next minute, a full foot; and a couple minutes later, you were back to being six feet tall. Sure enough, as you grew, you completely dried off, until you were good as new. You looked down at the diorama that had seemed so realistic when you were tiny, and at the canine who had seemed so massive. “So… that was pretty fun, right?”

“Fun’s not the word I would use,” you said, reaching down and carefully picking up the micro camera you had been holding.

“Oh, c’mon! It was, like, the world’s most destructive game of hide ‘n’ seek,” she giggles, seemingly still brimming with energy from the experience. “I think it was… actually super fun. Y’know, pretending to be some big, scary giantess.”

“Is that so?” You noted as you stepped carefully off the diorama.

“Yeah… I mean, like… I wouldn’t mind actually being that tall, y’know?” She said, her tail wagging as she trotted up beside you. “I just like the idea of… being bigger than everybody, yeah? Anytime I wanted to, I could just… squish some ugly building under my butt, or… step on some dudes…”

“You like the idea of crushing people?” You raised a brow.

“N-no! Of course not! Like, I would never want to hurt anybody. I just like… being in charge, I guess...” She covered her face with her forepaws paws in embarrassment, her cheeks burning red. “Ugh! Nevermind, it’s stupid.” You give her a weird look. Was the mightyena… getting off on pretending to be a giantess? That was a little weird, but it’s not like that’s your problem. Once this pilot was finished, you were never going to use those blasted Minimize blocks again.

“... whatever you say.” You try to forget she said anything. “So, are we done here?”

“Oh! Yeah,” she said, grabbing her things and following you out of the warehouse. “You know, I’m thinking of pitching this one to Hoenn TV first. I think they have the right audience for it.”

“And if it’s rejected?” You ask, handing her the footage.

“Well, I could make it a web series,” she shrugged.

“A web series? Seriously?” You stop in your tracks.

“I mean, like I said, it’s super low budget. And once people see what I can do, I’m sure I’ll attract my own audience,” she said happily, only to see that the weird look you’re giving her hasn’t abated. She seemed a little too passionate about Attack of the 50-Foot Mightyena, and now, you couldn’t help but wonder if she had ulterior motives. “Look, it’s not like I’m not planning on quitting my day job or anything. I just happen to think this concept is sorta genius, and I think it’ll really get people’s attention.”

“I mean, you do what you want. It’s your project,” you said, before parting ways with the mightyena. “I’ve really got to be going home, now. I’ll see you tomorrow.”

“Oh, uh, see ya!” She shouted as the two of you walked in opposite directions. You did your best to shake the day’s events out of your mind.

Over the next week or so, Lesia got to work finalizing her pitch. She sent the footage you two filmed to some freelance editor she knew, and he managed to turn the footage into something that genuinely looked like a movie-quality production. Meanwhile, Lesia finished sketching out the first hundred possible episodes, trying to come up with all the ways a massive mightyena might get up to mischief during a simple half hour time slot. Eventually, she sent you a text revealing she’s already shown the pitch to some studio execs at Hoenn TV. To your surprise...
11533212321111.title: Exit Stage Right

choices: They want you as the main character, the reporter.
They want you for something else entirley.
115332123211111.content:
To your immense surprise they loved it. You could practically hear the utter joy in Lesias text as you read it.
According to the wolf, the execs fell in love with it the second they saw it. She even mentioned they really enjoyed your performance, saying you almost looked really terrified. 'Almost' you morbidly muse. You were almost stepped on and almost swallowed by your vixen friend and they think it was almost?

You and Lesia kept going over plans for the show until she brought something else to your attention.

"So...one other thing. They want you as well" her text read out. You just blinked in surprise.

What do they want you for exactly?

Sorry if the color alignment is messed up. I'm typing this on a phone.
115332123211111.title: They loved it! ... but they have some stipulations

1153321232111112.content:
“They’ve got to be kidding. They know I’m not an actor, right?”

You’re sitting with Lesia at the local coffee shop during one of your daily meetings. “Coulda fooled them! They thought you were amazing in that pilot,” she smiled up at you, beaming like you were supposed to take this as an incredible opportunity. In reality, you could not be more upset.

“Yeah, only because I was genuinely terrified!” You grumbled, crossing your arms.

To your surprise, Lesia seemed taken aback by that, her ears pressing down against her head as she visibly softened. “R-really? Jeez, man. I didn’t know you were that scared…” She frowned, looking remorseful. “I’m really sorry. You should’ve said something. I would’ve found somebody else to play the part.”

You sigh, unable to stand the look on the adorable canine’s face. “It’s fine. It’s not your fault. I mean, I trust you. I know you wouldn’t hurt me,” you shake your head. “I just don’t like feeling… powerless like that. I just don’t want to go through that again.”

She stares up at you for a few seconds, before nodding thoughtfully. “Okay. I’ll respect whatever decision you make,” she said, her eyes drifting down to the ground. “I just want you to know… I know you’re just my talent manager and all, but… I’ve always kind of wanted to work with you. Y’know, like, on a project.” You furrow your brow as the mightyena confesses. She seemed almost emotional, for some reason. “I just… I think you’re a really cool guy. And I think you’re a lot smarter and more creative than you give yourself credit for.” She looks up into your eyes. “Plus… you respect me.”

“Respect you?” You raise a brow. “What do you mean?”

“You know what I mean. I’m a Pokémon! Even when I’m the one running the show, everyone treats me like I’m just there to look cute in front of a camera. People think it’s ‘adorable’ that I even know how to talk!” She almost growls in frustration, letting out all that pent up emotion and frustration. “But you… respect me as an artist. As a person. I never feel like I’m being talked down to when I’m around you, y’know?”

Your taken aback, unsure of how to respond. “... I… didn’t know it meant that much to you,” you confess. You’ve always treated Lesia as just another client. Sure, the fact that she’s a Pokémon was a little unorthodox, but once you got to know her, you’ve learned that she really isn’t different from anyone else. “Tell you what. I’ll give it some thought.”

“Seriously, if you don’t want to do it, you don’t have to. I won’t be upset or anything if you just tell me no,” she insisted. In response, you just reached down and playfully ruffle the fur atop her head a little, which seemed to make her perk up.

“Seriously, I’d love to help. It’s a big change, you know?” You say to her, and she smiles up at you. With that settled, you reach back and start digging through papers, ready to get down to the nitty gritty of your daily meeting. “Now, down to business...”

Over the next few weeks, while Lesia was wrapping up filming on the ninth and possibly final season of Detective Mightyena, you were keeping in contact with Hoenn TV and researching your prospects. For some reason, they think you’d perfectly fit the role of Clancy, the former owner of the rogue mightyena who’s trying desperately to right his wrongs and get the massive Pokémon under control. It’s a pretty major role, all things considered. Reading over the scripts, you were moderately intrigued. It was probably the kind of show you’d watch, if you had the time for tv. Still, acting always seemed stressful to you… especially if you’re three inches tall.

But you’ve never been too adverse to taking risks. You trust Lesia when she says things will be perfectly safe… so what’s the harm in saying yes? It seems like a very lucrative opportunity, one your dear old pop would be rolling in his grave to see you pass up. Maybe it was time to take a chance...
1153321232111112.title: Takes Some Convincing

11533212321111121.content:
“Rawr! Tremble in fear, puny humans, before your new queen — Lesia!”

Every since that fateful day she shrunk you down, Lesia just couldn’t stop thinking about it. The prospect of being so incredibly large and powerful was invigorating to her, in a weird way, and the longing to experience it again has been distracting her from her work. One day, she noticed something in a store window that she couldn’t ignore; realistic plastic figurines, all exactly three inches tall, which reminded her of you. With that fateful sight, she couldn’t hold back any longer, and Lesia discretely purchased as many of the figurines as she could. It couldn’t hurt to sneak back into the warehouse one night just to have a little fun, right?

And thus, here she was, standing in the center of the tiny replica city, the plastic figurines assembled all around her. As she stomped her way through the tiny streets, she could almost pretend she was really 50 feet tall, lording over the tiny humans below. “For too long, you humans have looked down on me! Now, I’m looking down on you!” She said, stifling a giggle as she put on a fake, dramatic, ‘intimidating’ tone. “And I’m not too impressed by what I see! Have no fear, though — I’m a kind and loving queen, so long as I’m giving the respect I deserve!”

She arranged a few figurines in rows in front of her, before tipping them over so it looks like they’re all bowing before her. “Yes, your majesty! We’ve all secretly loved and adored you all this time! We’d be honored to have you as our queen!” She ventriloquized in a squeaky, high-pitched voice, giggling to herself as she pulled back to look down on them. “Hehe! Yes, bow before the new queen of Hoenn!” It was fun to let loose and pretend like this sometimes. Yes, it was silly, of course, but that was part of the fun. “For my first act as queen, I shall make all Pokéblocks completely free, for all to enjoy! No longer will the berry farmers be able to hoard those delicious, sugary treats all to themselves!”

“Hip hip, hooray! Hip hip, hooray!” She ventriloquized, bouncing the figurines up and down so it looked like they were cheering. Chuckling to herself, she pondered what else she would do if she was the queen. Eventually, an idea struck her. “Ah! For my second act as queen, I shall have every gym… demolished! No longer will Pokemon be forced to fight in strenuous battles just so humans can gain useless little ‘badges’!” She smirked as she turned to the recently-replaced gym, walking over to it, turning around and swaying her rear back and forth. “Evacuate the gym, my beloved subjects! I’m afraid it’s going to have to go!”

In her head, she imagined a crowd of people fleeing from the gymnasium, intimidated by the sight of her rear hovering overhead. Once all the (imaginary) civilians were out of harm’s way, she gently pressed her butt down on the paper building’s ‘roof’, slowly putting more and more weight on the structure, to see just how much it could withstand. She yelped a bit, startled, when the ‘gym’ finally gave way beneath her. “Hehe! Oh, Arceus, this is sooo dumb…” She giggled to herself, breaking character for a moment, before turning to see what more mischief she could get up to.

Amid all the nondescript office buildings, she eventually laid eyes on familiar structure. “Oh! Yes, the battle institute. That must go, too, of course!” She said, trotting cheerfully over and lifting a paw. Without any fanfare, she easily destroyed the tiny structure with only a single, playful bat of her paw, bits of debris being strewn onto the roads in front of her. Leveling that blasted institute was certainly cathartic, even if it was only for pretend.

Eventually, she intentionally trotted downrange of a few toy soldiers she’d set up holding adorable little plastic machine guns. The moment she entered their ‘crosshairs’, she immediately feigned pain, before gasping. “Oh no! Rebels! You dare attack your queen?” She pretended to be outraged, and stomped her paw so hard that the tiny guns bounced out of the figurine’s hands. Once the ‘army’ was defeated, she stalked over to the figurines, licking her lips mischievously. “How rude! That’s no way to treat a lady… especially a lady like me! Looks like you’re all going to need some time out…”

Now for the moment she’d been so excited about. She was almost shaking with anticipations as she licked up a couple of the toy soldiers with her tongue, before swishing them around her maw and pressing them up against her cheeks, as if savoring their flavor. Eventually, she swallowed both of them almost by instinct, and was immediately surprised by how easily the figurines slid down her throat, and just how strangely pleasant it felt. She let out a small gasp as she felt their weight in her belly. The figurines were so small compared to her, they didn’t even leave a bulge. Nobody would have any idea of where they were except for her.

Unable to resist, she leaned forward and gulped down more of the figurines, feeling them so easily slip down into her body and come to rest in her warm tummy. Soon, they were making a few notable bulges in her gut, and she could feel them clearly all pressed together inside of her stomach. Her cheeks ran red as she closed her eyes and imagined that those figurines were real, tiny people, all curled up inside her body. Once all the toy soldiers had been devoured, she sat there, panting, trying to control her feelings. “Now, y-you all just sit in there and think about what you’ve done. I’ll l-let you out when you’re ready to be good little subjects,” she said to the figurines, patting her gut. “Y-you should be thanking me, really! It is an honor to be curled away inside your queen… all safe and warm…”

She tensed up, letting out a quiet, desperate whine as a jolt of… something ran up her spine. What was happening to her? She was enjoying this a little too much. As she imagined little, tiny humans snuggled safe and sound inside her, her whole body felt warm and tingly, and she started feeling a little light-headed. Just at that moment, she noticed another toy soldier lying in a nearby alleyway. Apparently, one of them had evaded her notice. “Oh? What’s this?” She gave a curt little smile, her face sweaty and red. “Did I miss you? My apologies! I’m a little s-stuffed right now, but I know another place you can serve out your p-punishment...”

With that, she turned, lifted her tail, and sat gently on the figurine. The toy was pressed into the squishy flesh of her rump as she lowered herself onto it, its entire ‘body’ being completely covered from sight beneath her butt. She playfully grinded down on the toy, careful not to damage the figurine, as she felt the pile of figurines inside her shift and stir with her every movement. As she sat there, she was reminded of that eventful night, when she took you up into her mouth and pretended to swallow you down for the camera. As much as she hated to admit it to herself, she desperately wished you would’ve let her gulp you down for real, so she could keep her beloved agent — no, her friend — safe and comfy inside her belly, if only for a little while…

Eventually, she decided to wrap this up. She had only come here to have a little fun, but things were getting a little more racy than she was expecting, and she didn’t want someone to stumble into the warehouse and think she was a total weirdo pervert. She stood up, ready for the moment of truth; would she be able to push these figurines out of her stomach herself, or would she have to get her stomach pumped? She’d been practicing at home, but never with this many. Sure enough, though, after only a few seconds of hacking and coughing, she spat the entire pile of figurines out into a puddle of saliva on the floor.

She did it! Now she knew for sure she could swallow someone at this size, keep them safe, and then spit them out unharmed. Of course, she’d be hard-pressed to convince anybody to let her do that… but just the knowledge that it was physically possible was exciting enough. “There! That wasn’t so bad, now was it? I hope you learned something from your time in-” She was saying triumphantly, only for her heart to sink when she was interrupted by the sound of the door being unlocked. Someone was entering the warehouse! She didn’t have any time to hide; she could only freeze up as the man walked in, to see her standing over a pile of saliva-drenched toy soldiers, surrounded by destroyed paper buildings.

It was one of the producers for Hoenn TV! Javier, his name was; the one with the five o'clock shadow and the strange, southern drawl. He gave her a weird look as he walked in. “Oh? Lesia? What are you doing here at this hour?” He asked.

She immediately hopped up to her feet. “W-what? Me? Oh, I was just… going over the choreography again! Gotta get everything just perfect, right? Heh!” She nervously faked a laugh, trying to act natural even though she was obviously panicked and embarrassed. She wasn’t very convincing, but somehow, Javier didn’t seem to notice anything wrong. Or, at least, he pretended he didn't.

“Oh, Lesia. I’ve been told you’re a perfectionist, and you certainly don’t disappoint,” he said, nonchalantly. He was about to return to his business, but he stopped in his tracks when he remembered something. “Ah! Yes, while you’re here; about the new production. Your agent friend contacted me earlier this evening. I think I have some very good news…”
11533212321111121.title: Lesia's Secret Fantasies

1153321232312211.content:
It was just a normal late Friday afternoon, nothing special was occurring at the moment. You had just finished your dinner, put the dishes in the dishwasher and you made your way to your room to settle down for the night. You were at your desk on your computer, looking at whatever you like to do on a lazy late Friday afternoon when there's nothing better to do than just surf the internet. As for your Pokemon, you had your very own Midnight Lycanroc, who you called Luna. You had found Luna a few years ago, as a Rockruff, who had appeared to be abandoned in an alleyway. It didn't take long your bond and friendship to grow, her to evolve into a Midnight Lycanroc, and before you knew it you were partners. Luna did a good job at keeping you company, she could be quite hyper and full of energy at times, but that just meant you two could have more fun together. Luna was also slightly bigger than most Lycanroc. She was about 4 feet more or less, from head to toe.

However, you last saw her resting on the couch in the living room, probably full from her dinner, so you two weren't together. You didn't decide to bother her and just let her sleep. She would come to you if she needed anything anyways. As you continued to do your thing on your computer, you suddenly heard the squeaking of your door opening. You stopped what your doing and swiveled around in your desk chair to see what was up. Immediately you were greeted with Luna pouncing on you! "Hiya Master!" She said excitedly as she pounced, landing just a few inches from you. Out of surprise, you jerk back, your back hitting the seat your were sitting in. "L-Luna! Don't scare me like that!" You reply, shouting just slightly.

As for Luna, she was just giggling away. "Aw come on, you are so scared easily. We need to work on you not be such a scaredy Meowth!" She replied in a joking manner. "A-Anyway, why are you here? I thought you were asleep in the living room?" You asked her, trying to change the subject at hand. "Well I was but I got kinda bored, sleeping is boring you know." She said to you with another giggle. Typical hyperactive Luna. "Also I came to you ask you something!" She said, looking excited, her stubby, little tail wagging with anticipation. "Sure, ask away." You say, now calmed down from getting spooked by her, and slightly curious for what she had in mind.

"Well..." She began. "Do you...
1153321232312211.title: The Clock Strikes Midnight

11533212323122112.content:
"Berry picking, huh?" You question.

"Yeah!" Luna exclaimed, "A great big field of berries bushes out in the forest. It's pretty close, too." You ponder it for a moment as Luna intently stares at you with a hopeful smile. It was a tad late in the afternoon but admittedly it has been a while since you took her on an outing in the great outdoors and the fruit bowl in the kitchen was also starting to look a bit empty. Not only that, but Luna can get a bit mischievous around the house if she's left bored for too long.

You bend down and give her a quick pat on the head, saying "Sounds good! I'll go grab a basket."

"Yes!" She yelled, practically doing a little jig as you dug through the closet to find the basket. You went out berry picking with her in the past but you've never seen her get this pumped up about it. Either she was really craving berries right now or she has a lot of pent up energy she needs to get rid of. As you blindly feel around the dark closet your hand pokes into something that makes the distinctive high-pitched creaking of a wicker basket so you grab it and take it out. With the basket in hand, you put on some shoes, grab the keys to the house and make for the exit as Luna closely follows you.

With the house locked up you set off with Luna to her proclaimed perfect berry picking spot. "Come on, Slowpoke!" She yelled over her shoulder. You were essentially power-walking as you tried to keep up with the impatient Lycanroc, her small tail whipping side-to-side at incredible speeds. When you finally caught up to her you quickly grabbed her hand and almost instantly she slowed down. Luna beamed up at you with happy red eyes before she turned back to the path, her clawed fingers wrapping tighter around yours. You breathed a sigh of relief at the fact you prevented your leisurely outing from becoming a strenuous workout. Luna was always a sucker for physical affection.

Shafts of orange afternoon light beamed through the canopy as the pair of you casually walked along the forest path. For a while you thought that Luna forgot about the whole berry picking objective as she leaned against your side but rather suddenly she pulled away off the track and into the woods. Luna was being uncharacteristically quiet while she guided you through the forest, her determined eyes pinned forward. After ten or so minutes of hiking past trees and bushes you could see a clearing ahead, the bright and colorful berries already visible through the underbrush. "We're here!" She happily yipped, her pace increasing until she was essentially dragging you along.

Entering the clearing, you were impressed. There were dozens of berry bushes that were all covered in a strange berry you never saw before. They were all a light blue and had a pear shape to them. Luna tore away from your hand and dashed toward one of the berry bushes. She grasped a berry from the bush and planted it into her mouth before she grabbed another and pointed it at you, beckoning you over. "Here, here!" She said, her voice muffled by the blue berry lodged in her maw.

"Jeez, calm down," you say as you chuckle at her enthusiasm. "You'll choke." Luna takes a bite from the berry in her mouth and pulls the remaining mass out of her mouth before she speaks up again.

"I'm serious, you've got to try these!" She barked.

Setting the basket next to the tree you take the berry she offered you. You were apprehensive about eating a berry you've never seen before but they were obviously edible since Luna apparently enjoyed them enough to take you all the way out here for them. Biting down into the soft flesh of the berry revealed an explosion of juicy sweetness. Gulping it down you give Luna the thumbs up, "It's pretty good."

"Darn right." She said. After the both of you finished your berries the two of you started picking berries and put them into the wicker basket and before long it was filled to the brim with the blue berries. With a full basket you plant yourself down onto the grass with a berry in your hand, enjoying the peace and quiet with your Lycanroc. Although you started noticing something off about Luna; she seemed to be constantly glancing over to you as you both enjoyed your meal, looking incredibly curious.

"Is there something on my face?" You say, breaking the silence. Luna almost jumped at the words.

"U-um... No..." She said as she turned her full attention to the berry she was nibbling on. Now you were getting suspicious. Her face had the same look as the time she accidentally broke your alarm clock and tried to hide it from you that one time. "Hey, are you feeling alright?" She asked, leaning in closer to you.

You furrowed your brow at her as you tried to figure out what she was planning. "Yes? Should I not be?" Luna just shook her head and focused her attention to the berry in her paws while you tried to ignore her strange behavior. Although, now that she mentioned it you were beginning to feel a little strange. All over your body there was a slight tingling sensation that was getting harder to ignore and it felt like you were slowly sinking into the grass. Your clothes were beginning to feel baggy and your shoes felt extremely loose but the part that definitely tipped off that something was wrong was when you looked over to Luna; you both were sitting at eye level with each other.

Luna's eyes lit up when she looked over at you. Your perspective was slowly but surely lowering and from her own perspective what was happening was quite clear; you were shrinking. She let out a surprised yip, "It's working!"

"Did you know this would happen?" You said, trying not to panic. By now you were small enough you had to look up at the Lycanroc and the fact she was leaning over you made you feel even smaller.

A toothy mischievous grin plastered her face. "I met someone that said these berries do something really interesting to humans. Honestly, I thought it would turn you into a Pokemon or at the very least make your skin blue but this is cool, too!" She said, her smile widening even further. "I'm already thinking of some of the fun things we could do."

"R-right." You gulped. She looked way too excited about what was happening to you. By now you were probably half the size of Luna and your clothes were beginning to become too large to be of use. As you continued to diminish and get tangled in the sea of fabrics you could only wonder how small you were going to get.

choices: Do you think you can shrink me more?
1153322222222111.content:
"Man, today is one of one of those days, isn't it?" You say, laying on your couch, watching TV. Nothing is on, and there is nothing to do. It's just you, and your best friend Joltik laying on you.

"Jol..." She agrees, almost half asleep. After a minute of you two doing nothing, Joltik then jumps up with an idea. "Tik!" She exclaims, crawling up your body to your head.

You don't pay any attention to what she's doing, almost falling asleep yourself, until you feel a weird jolt on the back of your neck. It didn't hurt by chance, but it did wake you back up. You sit up, as Joltik crawls to the center of your shirt. "I'm awake, I'm awake." You say, rubbing the place where Joltik shocked you, "What is it?"

Weirdly, Joltik says nothing, instead she just starts to nuzzle you. You crack a smile, giving her a little pet, as you lay back down. You space out for a second, thinking about whatever, when you feel something weird. You look down to see Joltik still laying on you, very much happy, but she seems... bigger. You think it's nothing, as you decide to space out again.

When you come to again, you feel an increased weight on your body. You look down to see Joltik again, now laying still, eyes closed, but she does seem different. You don't remember her weighing this much, do you? Instead of blanking out again, you decide to observe your fluffy friend.

After a minute of watching, you notice a gradual changing of size, as Joltik is now covering your belly. "Uh, Joltik, is everything alright?" You calmly ask, siting up again. Looking around you, however, shows that what's wrong is you, as you seem to be shrinking. You are now pretty small compared to the surrounding couch, and you don't seem to show signs of stopping.

Even Joltik is now half your size,covering your legs as well now, so you are now 8 inches. "Joltik, what's happening to me?" You ask, as you urgently shake her awake. She opens her eyes, gets off your body, and looks at you, noticing the changing size difference. "It actually worked! It had a slim chance of working, but it worked!" Joltik yells out with glee.

"Wait, you can talk!?" You ask surprised, as you now reach her size, and still shrinking.

"You can understand me!?" Joltik says surprised as well. "This must be a side effect of the shrinking."

"Why did you shrink me?" You question, as you stop shrinking at the one inch mark, where Joltik is now looming over you.

"C'mon, I've seen your browser history." She retorts, making you blush in embarrassment,"And besides, we have something to do today, so that's a plus. Before we do anything, can I do something real quick?"

"Uh, sure." You say, which Joltik excitedly lays on you, smothering you in her fluff. You then feel her legs wrap around your back, as she rolls over, giving you a full body hug. To be honest, she feels pretty warm and soft, like you can just lay on her all day. She then lets go of you, as you lay on her soft underbelly.

"I always wanted to hug you like that" She sighs "So, what do you want to do?"

You think for a bit, before saying...
1153322222222111.title: Big Fluffbug

11533222222221112.content:
"Do you think you can shrink me more?" You ask Joltik, as she gives you a surprised face.

"Shrink you more?" She repeats in bewilderment, "C'mon, you're already the quarter size of the smallest Pokemon... but if that's what you want, let's get started." She smiles. She allows you to slide off of her belly before getting rolling over. "This is going to be way harder to do due to your smaller nature, but it's doable. Sitting down would make it easier, probably.

You sit down to Joltik's saying, as her shadow looms over you. You feel her warm breath wash over your backside, and her fluff brush on you from time to time, until you feel a sharp zap onto your neck. "Oww.." You moan, rubbing where you were zapped.

"Sorry, it probably hurts a bit more when your smaller, but I think I got the right spot." Right as she finishes her sentence, you feel a weird sensation come over your body like last time, as your yellow friend begins to grow again. You shrink to about...

121.content: Which one will the story feature?
121.title: Ralts/Kirlia/Gardevoir

choices: Kai only ends up shrinking a few inches.
Kai shrinks down a whole foot!
Kai shrinks down more than a foot.
1211.content:
"Master! Master!" You feel groggy, yesterday was a long day of traveling. "Master..." The mountains just seemed to span on for miles, you felt accomplished that you were able to make it over them before sunset. "Master, come on, wake up!" Making it to the Pokemon Center you just wanted to sleep and sleep and sleep. Sleep the day away. Just keep sleeping. Sleep. Forever. "Wake up! Kai!"

"Huh?!" You wake up in a jolt at the sound of your name. Standing next to your bedside you see your trusty traveling companion, Grace the gardevoir. Standing at an average 5'3", Grace is a beautiful being. With a cute face, short curly hair, a thin body, sizable breasts, and a faint green glow it is easy to see how she is often the center of everyone's attention. Today she is clothed in a cute yellow sun dress that goes down to her knees and hugs her body shapely which is accompanied by a wide brimmed sunhat. You have been raising Grace ever since you were a kid, back when she was still a ralts. She has always been a sweet and caring individual to everyone around her, but especially to you. Though she can be really timid. After beginning your pokemon journey some month and a half ago, Grace has become more and more adept in her psychic abilities, learning new moves and techniques on a regular basis. Just the other day she was experimenting with a new move, though she hasn't told you what it is all about yet. "Oh, good morning Grace."

"You overslept again Master," starts Grace worriedly, "If you don't keep a better sleeping schedule you are bound to get sick." Looking at the clock, you notice that it is almost noon. Grace starts again, "I went down and ordered breakfast from the nice ladies downstairs half an hour ago, it's probably cold now." Slowly you begin to raise yourself up from your bed and rise to your feet. You stand about 5 inches taller than Grace at about 5'8". Currently your 18 years old but you feel like you have the appearance of someone a couple years younger. You're thin and not too muscular, you have shaggy brown hair and brown eyes, right now you still have the red t-shirt and shorts you wore yesterday and fell asleep with.

"Maybe you're right, I have felt like I've been over working myself lately," you reply, "I think we both could use a lazy day, don't you?" Sitting down to eat your cold eggs and bacon, you wait for Grace's response.

"I think that sounds great Master, besides it would give me time to play around with that new ability I was messing with. I think I almost have it perfected." Grace appears to be getting excited, you begin to really wonder what she has been up to lately. "Do you think you could help me test it Master?"

"Of course Grace, I love helping you," you say smiley, "I mean you help me with tons of things already so it's nice to return the favor often." You notice Grace's face as it begins to grow a light shade of red as she bursts into a smile. Standing up to stretch and throw away your finished plate you begin to finish your thoughts. " So what's this new move all about? Is it dangerous?"

"Well, I've been trying to learn how to condense objects using my psychics. So far I've had good success with stuff I've tested it on during our journeys, but I haven't tested it on any living being." You begin to stare at her with wide eyes. "And... well, I was wondering if I could test it on... you."

"A-are you saying you want to try and shrink me?" After a short pause, Grace slowly nods. You stand there shocked, secretly you've always had a fetish for shrinking down and looking up at the world from a tiny perspective. You begin to worry that Grace might have figured out about your fetish and developed this move just to please you, but your not sure how she would have figured such a thing out, you good at hiding your tracks. "Well... I'm fine about it as long as it's not dangerous."

"Oh, thank you Master! And don't you worry, this won't hurt a bit, I wouldn't ever do something that would cause you pain." Grace moves up her arms and points them towards your chest. Slowly her eyes begin to glow as a psychic aura begins to illuminate around her hands. Soon, you notice the same aura circling around your body. Your body begins to tingle all over and you begin to grow increasingly dizzy. In a matter of moments your surroundings begin to look bigger. Grace begins to look bigger. Oh my god, you're really shrinking!

How much will Kai shrink?
1211.title: Grace and Kai

choices: "How about we just relax, stay inside, and order some room service."
"Let's take a stroll around town! I'm sure there's somewhere to eat nearby."
12111.content:
As quickly as Kai's shrinkage began, it abruptly ended. Tumbling backwards due to his dizziness, all Kai could make out of the world was a blur of different shapes and colors. Overall, Kai felt extremely nauseous and felt tempted to empty out his breakfast onto the floor. Soon, Kai's muscles began to feel sore and he felt sharp jolts of pain developing in his joints and stomach. Leaning against the wall for support, Kai could hear the faint voice of Grace seemingly yelling for his well-being. "Master! Oh, Master, please be okay!" His vision was soon blocked by Grace's green color as she attempted to support her Master. Eventually, after about 10 minutes of what seemed like torture, Kai's nauseousness started to subside, his vision began to return, and he could properly rise to his feet. And the first thing he noticed was how he was looking eye-to-eye at Grace.

"Oh thank God you're alright," Grace was quick to jump towards you and capture you in a tight, loving hug. "I'm so sorry, I didn't think anything like that would happen. I can be so stupid sometimes. Please forgive me!" Grace was on the breaking point of crying, even though the whole ordeal left you nauseous, sore, and temporarily blind, you couldn't stay mad at Grace.

"Don't beat yourself up Grace, you couldn't of possibly known something like that would happen," you reply to Grace reassuringly, "Besides, I'm okay now. And look, your move was a success, I'm the same height as you now!" Releasing you from her tight grasp and wiping away her tears, Grace's lovely smile returned as she looked you down, appreciating her handiwork.

"I guess you're right, thank you for being so understand and sweet Master. I'll be sure to be more careful next time though." It is hard for you not to smile as you see Grace's glowing disposition. "Well now that we know I can properly shrink living things, I'm guessing that you want to return to your normal height?" Although she was trying to hide it, you could sense that Grace felt a little disappointed at that idea, though your mind was already set on what you wanted to do.

"Are you kidding me? There is no way I'm going to go through what I just went through again so soon. Besides, who knows, it might be fun being your size for a little while." You could tell Grace liked that idea as she began to perk up and her smile started to widen once again.

"Phew, I was hoping you'd say something like that. You see, shrinking something or someone like that takes a lot of energy, I don't know I have it in me right now to grow you back even if you wanted to." Coming in for another hug, the two of you begin to sway back and forth, cradling each other in your arms, you're both just glad each other are alright. This goes on for over a minute before being interrupted by the sound of Grace's growling stomach. "Oh, excuse me! I guess I'm a little hungry after everything that has just happened. I suppose we should get on with the rest of today anyway. So what do you think we should do Master?"

"Hmm," you pause to contemplate at your options.
12111.title: Looking at each other eye-to-eye.

121112.content:
"That sounds like a wonderful idea Master, but I think you should do a bit of freshening up first though." She was right. Looking down at yourself you remember you're still wearing your clothes (which conveniently shrunk with you) from the previous day. Plus your nose can't help but notice the putrid smell emanating from your body. All that adventuring and shrinking has left you a sweaty mess. Usually you try to take good care of your appearance, your filth makes you feel sorta embarrassed, though that embarrassment might also stem from the fact you wouldn't have noticed the filth if Grace didn't point it out.

"I... I think I'm going to take a shower," you say, stuttering.

"Sounds like another wonderful idea Master. You're on a roll today," replied Grace, sarcastically. You can't help but blush as Grace smiles at you humorously. You don't find it often where Grace is bold enough to fool around like that. She must of gotten a confidence boost from seeing you at her own height. You feel happy for her, you do quite enjoy seeing the sillier side of her every once and a while.

Your shower goes by quicker than normal due to there being less of you to wash now. The shower head feels significantly higher than it used to be, which you expected, but that doesn't stop it from feeling weird nonetheless. As you emerge from the shower Grace is quick to hand you a pair of clean clothes that she shrunk while you were washing up, a pair of cargo shorts and a blue button up shirt. They fit your body nicely if not an ever bit loose. Putting on your only pair of shoes, which Grace also kindly shrunk for you, you feel ready now to start the day. "Are you ready to hit the town Grace?"

"I'm ready when you are cutie."

"What was that? I didn't catch that last part."

"Oh... uh, I said I'm ready when... ready when you are Master." You can't help but notice how red her face has become and you start to chuckle.

"He he he. Then what are we waiting for, I'm starving, let's go!" As the two of you are leaving your room and the pokemon center you begin to notice just how much bigger the world has become. Sure five inches may not be a huge drop in height but it is definitely enough to give yourself a new, shorter perspective. As you walk to downtown you start to take note of the height of the people walking around you. Of course most kids and young teenagers you notice are still shorter than you, but, you have trouble finding anyone close to your age at a similar height or shorter. It sorta feels awkward to walk by a guy the same age as you but a full six or seven inches taller. If it wasn't for Grace by your side you would definitely not be as confident about being shrunk as you are right now.

Finally, after a short ten minute walk into the heart of the city, you and Grace decide to sit down and eat at an outdoor sandwich shop near the town's square. The two of you order a plate of sandwiches, chips, and fruit to split while you enjoy the morning air and sunshine. "It sure is beautiful today," you say, trying to kick start a conversation.

"Sure is, maybe later we can get some battling in Master, I've been itching for some more practice. It is the perfect day." Grace bites into her second sandwich, she seems hungry as she is quickly devouring her side of the platter. You suppose shrinking stuff leads to quite the appetite.

"Oh, you don't have to convince me Grace, we can do some battling after we eat if you're up for it." Your eyes slowly begin to focus in on a group of trainers and their pokemon walking towards what looks like a park in the distance.

"Yay! Thank you Master cutie."

"You're welcome Grace cutie." Grace blushes again at your remark. Soon the two of you finish up with your meal and begin to head towards the park you saw with the other trainers. Right of the bat you notice two people specifically who grab your attention. A tall, buff looking man with his Machamp and a girl around your age with her Slurpuff. Both look like admirable opponents and good experience for Grace. The question is though: who do you ask for a battle?
121112.title: Out on the town

12222.content:
"How many times have I warned you about this?" You sigh before applying a small dab of peroxide upon a wash rag. Carefully, you rub the rag upon Your Umbreon's injured ears making a small grunt escape her mouth. Despite the treatment, She remained perfectly seated upon her knees while gazing down at the floor with a bitter yet ashamed expression on her face.

"They did it again." she mumbles with a huff. By now you were used to your Umbreon, Darcell getting into fights outside of your home. But now however, it seemed like she was constantly returning home with scraps or bruises upon her body. Ever since she managed to encounter some pokemon belonging to rich families not too far off, that short temper of hers has lead her to constant skirmishes with the lot.

"It doesn't matter Darcell." you scold while continuing to tend her injuries. "You should know they'd try and pick fights with you over there."

"But this time was different..." She growls while turning her head slightly to gaze at you. "They called you a weak, useless commoner!" She huffs. "what else was I suppose to do? Just stand there and accept that?"

"Those are just words Darcell." You state in a stern voice. "nothing but a way of trying to lead you into trouble."

"Well they sure got the trouble they wanted..." Darcell mutters still in a snit.

With one final rub on her other pointy ear, you place the rag down on your knee. "Listen...you shouldn't try and fall into their plans." you begin with a sigh. "If trouble comes knocking, the best thing to do is try and avoid it completely."

"Even when they said all those lies about you?" She asks.

"Even then." you state with a nod. "Violence is something that should be considered as a last resort." you explain. "And despite that, you should always try and step away from it as best as you can. It's best to think before actually rushing head on into a mess." Darcell remains seated after your lecture as her eyes were focused entirely on the floor. Just by the silence and gaze she was giving, it was clear guilt overcame her. With a sigh, you rise up from your seat before gently patting her head. "Though, I'm thankful you stood up for me." You admit while mustering a small smile.

Darcell, taken by surprise from the comments gazes up at you before mustering a smile. "R-right." she says before slowly standing up herself.

"Now how about we get some ice cream from the fridge? That should help try and cool you off." you say in a rather light hearted manner as Darcell simply chuckles in response.

"Sounds like a plan to me." She replies as both you and her make your way into the kitchen. After filling the bowls with a few scoops of strawberry and vanilla ice cream, you both soon return to the living room before sitting upon the couch. With a flick of a switch, the television set soon beams showing a local pokemon fight occurring.

"Hey Master?" Darcell. "Says with a spoon of ice cream still in her mouth.

"What's up?" You ask, freezing your motions from placing the spoon in your mouth.

"You did say fighting is wrong earlier...but what about pokemon fights like this?" She asks turning her head so her red eyes were gazing upon you.

"Well...this is different." You state before placing the spoon in your mouth. "Here, it's mainly about sportsmanship and rules to follow. It isn't ALL about needless violence against others."

Darcell gives a sigh as she places her spoon back inside her bowl. "Do...you think I might be able to make it there one day?" she asks.

"Huh?" you mutter confused by her words before gazing back at the screen. "You mean a pokemon tournament?"

Darcell Nods upon your question. "Yeah...do you think I might be able to join there one of these days?"

After a brief second of silence you simply give a light shrug of your shoulders. "Sure." you answer while setting your empty bowl upon the nearest table.

"Really!?" Darcell stammers, as if taken aback by your response.

"I don't see why not." You shrug. "I mean, you certainly have the skills to fight back that's for sure. Plus, it will give you a good reason to stop pummeling other pokemon." You add with a light chuckle.

Darcell simply chuckles in response while giving a small eye roll. "Funny Master."

After around half an hour or so of watching the matches, you soon begin to rise up and give a drowsy stretch. "Man,, I'm beat." you grunt while finishing up your stretch. "I think I'll hit the hay now." Curiously, you gaze down at Darcell as she continues to sit and watch the match. "You gonna finish this up?" you ask curiously.

Darcell, quickly shifts her attention up at you before nodding. "uh huh...yeah."

"Well...Don't stay up too late alright?" you insists before making your way down the dark hallway towards your room. As you continue to walk down however, to your confusion it seemed almost as if you were continuing your way down the dark area. "W-What's going on here?" you think aloud with a raised brow before stopping in place. Within a matter of seconds, the whole area soon begins to fade into a complete darkness, leaving you alone within the strange depths. "Is this some sort of trick?" you mutter, unsure if this was reality or some sort of dream. Dumbfounded, you slowly continue onwards while spreading your arms out in front of you to touch any approaching obstacle. After a couples steps forward, your hand soon ends up coming into contact with a rather odd object. "w-what the?" you murmur feeling about the strange surface. Oddly enough, it felt almost like-
12222.title: The rowdy Umbreon

1223.content:
You have been living with your Sylveon, Sylvia, for almost three years now. She is really attached to you as you are attached to her. You've always been there for her and she's always been there for you. She was your first pokemon; you got her as an Eevee. Then your bond became incredibly strong and Eevee evolved into Sylveon. You felt honored when it happened, because it meant that she was really affectionate to you.
~
After a busy day, you finally return home. You plan to hit the hay as soon you get home. When you finally reach your house, you open the door and someone tackles you to the ground. You start to struggle as a soft tongue starts to lick you all over "Come on Sylvia, let me go" you say laughing as her tongue tickles you. After a good amount of time, Sylvia finally gets off you. You get up and pet her head. Your Sylveon purrs happily. You smile as you let out a deep yawn "*Yawn* I'm sorry Sylvia, I'm really tired. We'll play tomorrow, okay?" you say. Sylvia smiles at you, before jumping into your arms. This takes you by surprise "Sylvia, wha-" you say, but she cuts you off, pressing her lips on your cheek. You feel your energy being drained "That's draining kiss. Sylvia, what are you do...." you don't get to finish as you fall unconscious.
~
When you wake up, you feel like a lot of time has passed. You have an headache and notice you are laying down on a soft surface of some sort. You painfully get up to find out you're laying on....
1223.title: A BIG surprise

124.content: How about one of the Charmander lines? Any one of them catch your interest?
124.title: Charmander/Charmeleon/Chairzard

choices: "I can show you outside right now."
1243.content:
*Originally posted by "The Swift Gale"
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----

"Ah! what a beautiful day!" You state out loud while raising your hands up in a quick stretch. Days like this were truly hard to come by nowadays. The sun graced the blue plains above as only a small amount of clouds were adorned besides it's magnificence. A light breeze casually blows past you on occasion as the sounds of Fletchling's chirping melodically sounded off nearly all about. "Wouldn't you say so Brande?" you ask while turning your head to the side to gaze upon your pokemon companion.

While you certainly we're enjoying this fine weathered day, your Charizard ally unfortunately didn't share the same enthusiasm as you. "I-I guess..." She stutters in a meek soft voice as her head repeatedly turns about to gaze upon her surroundings. Just by the look on her eyes and the lowered position of her neck, it was obvious to tell she was nervous about this peaceful walk.

Your smile from earlier soon begins to fade seeing just how terrified your dragon pokemon appeared to be. With all rights however, after what she went through as a Charmander there was no wonder why she was so timid and anxious of being out. A couple years ago when walking about in a nearby forest, you managed to come across a lone Charmander being attacked by a group of fierce spearows. She was clearly outnumbered and curled up in a ball shaking like crazy as they unleashed their attacks upon her. Glimpsing at the unfair fight, you immediately grabbed the nearest stick before charging up against the gang of flying pokemon. After a bit of scratches and pecks, you soon managed to stand victorious as they immediately fled from the area. Despite the spearow's fleeing, the Charmander still remained balled up shaking and quivering uncontrollably. While it did take some time to calm her down completely, it seemed that right then and there you two were entwined in a partnership.

"It's alright Brande." You state in an assuring tone as you approach her and gently pat her shoulders. While her anxious and wary attitude as a Charmander did manage to soften up a bit, a huge portion of it remained even in her final evolution. "There's hardly any wild pokemon down this route. Heck! the only thing here wild are those fletchling's up there." You say while pointing your finger up at one of the small pokemon perched upon a high branch.

"B-But...what if someone wants to battle?" She retorts, fearing having to go against another pokemon in combat. Despite being in some skirmishes in the past, Brande absolutely loathed the idea of fighting, mainly due to her 'Scaredy' like manner.

"Well, if that happens I'll simply say no." You reply back with a small shrug. "I'm sure it wouldn't matter so much to them. Besides, this route is commonly used by starting trainers. I doubt they'd want to battle against a fully evolved Charmander."

"I...I suppose so." Brande slowly nods her head in agreement, though her tense attitude persisted.

A small sigh escapes as you gaze up at her face. "Come on. We'll take the short route to head back home okay?" "R-right." she responds giving a quick sigh of her own. After taking a quick scenic route down a tree filled path, you both manage to make your way back to the familiar area that was your home. "Ah. here we are." you state in a proud manner. "Home sweet home. Huh Brande?" you ask as only silence seemed to answer your question. "Hmmm?" Confused, you turn your head back to notice Brande gazing down at the grassy ground with her hands clasped together. "Brande?...is something wrong?"

A disappointed expression takes up her face as her eyes appeared to be on the verge of tears. "Brande. What's wrong?" you repeat the question while approaching the orange dragon. "I'm sorry Master..." She stammers in a weak voice. "If...If only I wasn't so scared of other pokemon...we wouldn't have such short walks." She explains, clearly having guilt over the sudden change of course.

"Hey hey hey!" you stammer taken aback by her words. "It's alright." you reassure her while reaching up to pat her head.

"But it's not." she retorts giving a sniffle. "It's been years now...and I'm still just as scared as I was a Charmander." She states using one of her claw like hands to wipe her eyes. "I'm...I'm not even sure I can conquer this fear." she adds with a small hiccup.

"Well...then, we'll just have to keep on trying." you respond as she gazes at you in surprise and confusion. "Everyone has their own fears Brande, including myself. But I honestly think you could brave your way through that fearfulness of yours." You state with a smile. "I mean you're strong. Stronger than me that's for sure." you add, knowing full well how she has the strength to embrace you in a bear hug with complete ease. "Besides, I'll be there to help you out as well, so no need to fret alright?" You add with a smile to boot.

One small sniffle emerges from Brande as she nods her head in response. With a good wipe of her claw, she smiles down at you with gratitude replacing the fear. "Thank you Master." she states before gently embracing you in a light hug. "No prob Brande." you reply back giving her back an assuring set of pats. "Now, Let's get inside okay?" you suggest while turning your head towards the doorway of your home.

While you were expecting to be let free by now, Brande oddly kept you close in the embrace. "Huh?" you mumble gazing up at her utterly confused.
